responded: Now I understand the issue! The problem is in the `op_yank` function at line 1272 in `src/register.c`. When we call `STRLEN(bd.textstart)`, we're potentially reading beyond the allocated buffer because `bd.textstart` points to `p + startcol` where `p` is the line buffer, but we don't check if `startcol` is within the valid bounds of the line.

The issue is that `bd.textstart` can point beyond the actual text content of the line, and when `STRLEN()` is called on it, it reads memory until it finds a null terminator, which may be beyond the allocated buffer.
